questions.text: Which tense is used in this sentence? 'She has been working here for two years.'
questions.explanation: The structure 'has/have + been + verb-ing' indicates the Present Perfect Continuous tense, used for actions starting in the past and continuing to the present.

questions.text: Fill in the blank: 'I _____ him yesterday.'
questions.explanation: The specific time indicator 'yesterday' requires the Past Simple tense (met).

questions.text: Choose the correct verb form: 'The sun _____ in the east.'
questions.explanation: Universal truths and facts use the Present Simple tense.

questions.text: Identify the tense: 'By this time tomorrow, I will have finished the project.'
questions.explanation: The structure 'will have + past participle' indicates the Future Perfect tense, used for actions that will be completed by a specific future time.

questions.text: Fill in the blank: 'When I arrived at the station, the train _____ already _____.'
questions.explanation: The Past Perfect tense (had left) is used to show an action that was completed before another action in the past.

questions.text: Which sentence is in the Present Continuous Tense?
questions.explanation: The structure 'subject + is/am/are + verb-ing' indicates the Present Continuous tense.

questions.text: Fill in the blank: 'If it rains, we _____ the picnic.'
questions.explanation: This is a First Conditional sentence (If + Present Simple, ... Future Simple).

questions.text: Choose the correct option: 'Look! The baby _____.'
questions.explanation: The exclamation 'Look!' suggests an action is happening right now, requiring the Present Continuous tense.

questions.text: Identify the tense: 'I was reading a book when you called.'
questions.explanation: The structure 'was/were + verb-ing' indicates the Past Continuous tense.

questions.text: Fill in the blank: 'I _____ to London three times so far.'
questions.explanation: The Present Perfect tense (have been) is used to describe life experiences when the specific time is not important or not mentioned.
